org.apache.flink.table.store.file.sort

Class BinaryInMemorySortBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.table.store.file.sort.BinaryIndexedSortable
      • org.apache.flink.table.store.file.sort.BinaryInMemorySortBuffer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IndexedSortable, SortBuffer

    public class BinaryInMemorySortBuffer
extends BinaryIndexedSortable
implements SortBuffer
    In memory sort buffer for binary row. The main code is copied from Flink BinaryInMemorySortBuffer instead of extended because it's a final class.

    The main differences in the new sort buffer are:

    • 1. Add clear method to clean all memory.
    • 2. Add tryInitialized() method to initialize memory before write and read in buffer, while the old buffer will do it in the constructor and reset().
    • 3. Remove reset() and etc. methods which are not used in flink table store.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        We add clear() method here instead of reset() to release all memory segments. The reset() method in flink sort buffer will clear memory and grab two buffers for currentSortIndexSegment and recordCollector.
        Specified by:
        clear in interface SortBuffer

      • write

        public boolean write(InternalRow record)
              throws IOException
        Writes a given record to this sort buffer. The written record will be appended and take the last logical position.
        Specified by:
        write in interface SortBuffer
        Parameters:
        record - The record to be written.
        Returns:
        True, if the record was successfully written, false, if the sort buffer was full.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown, if an error occurred while serializing the record into the buffers.
